title: PSA:  Every role is still human and capable of making mistakes
body:
So I'm a Jungle main. Lately the boards are making it seem like Jungle and Support can do no wrong. So I just want to say:

*Supports can have bad games and play like shit*

*Junglers can have bad games and play like shit*

*ADCs can have bad games and play like shit*

*Mid laners can have bad games and play like shit*

*Top laners can have bad games and play like shit*

**Also:**

* It's not ALWAYS the ADC's fault if bot lane loses

* It's not ALWAYS a good time to leave your ADC alone in lane

* It's not ALWAYS your laner's fault they don't have 360° perma-vision around their lane

* It's not ALWAYS a good time to farm jungle

* It's not ALWAYS a good time to be top side when there's an infernal drake on the map

* It's not ALWAYS your jungler's fault you died

* It's not ALWAYS a good idea to gank the 3/0 Darius

* It's not ALWAYS your teams fault for not following up a bad engage

* It's not ALWAYS someone else's fault you didnt win

Lets be honest. I could keep this list going for hundreds of examples. What are you people expecting from your team mates exactly? Every single one of us makes mistakes. Maybe there is a reason your team mates aren't Challenger? Or that you aren't Challenger either?

Ffs stop crying about other people's mistakes and maybe start focusing on your own. And ffs stop acting like Junglers and Supports can do no wrong.

Realistically this is a really good point of "Don't blame someone because they are not doing well". but even better: **play a champion who does not fall off**

Whenever I'm in an unfavorable matchup and I do not feel comfortable with my teams picks for roles, out of paper and scissors, I pick {{champion:54}}. Champions with hard CC (a powerful one) engage, or general tankiness that is not hard to pull off, that are basically giant targets that cannot be mowed down easily are some of the most reliable in the game. {{champion:57}} is in a similar fashion of "Proxy carry" where it doesn't matter how badly you went in lane phase as long as your team can work self-sufficiently with you still being being a massive threat because of your tankiness, sustain, damage reduction, and hard CC. 20% damage reduction is insane later on. Or {{champion:18}} , who's damage and arguably entire kit is useful at any point in the game, packing CC, an AS steroid, AoE damage, and a large burst of damage to both champions AND towers.

oh btw. I get people can use him effectively, but even built tank, {{champion:33}} is just currently not enough to suffice unless it his midgame. otherwise, early on he's too squishy thanks to his cooldowns and mana and is easily harassed by ranged top-lane opponents. late game most Carries will have optimized against him, or simply mow him down before he becomes a problem ( {{champion:222}} or {{champion:96}} ) Best to either keep practicing in comps you know will work even if you're far behind, because his CC is still valuable, as is his taunt.

this helps work out that feeling of "I'm useless" or "my jungler is useless". Kinda hard to argue "he did nothing" when one unstoppable force can win an entire teamfight.
